airtrafficcontrol

Class RunEHLsATCAppForConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • airtrafficcontrol.RunEHLsATCAppForConsole

  • public class RunEHLsATCAppForConsole
extends java.lang.Object
    EHL's AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL app for console. Executable file.

    Description

    Runnable class to perform actions of air traffic control.
    This app allows the user to manage a set of flights, inserting them into the app either from a file or manually, with the purpose of monitoring the geographic coordinates of the airships at each moment in time and producing reports of the airships transgressing the pre-established air corridors.

    For more informations read the «USER'S GUIDE.txt» available in the «airtrafficcontrol» directory.

    Author:
    Eva Gomes, Hugo Leal, Lucas Andrade

    Copyright (c) 2014, EHL. All rights reserved. DO NOT ALTER OR REMOVE COPYRIGHT NOTICES OR THIS FILE HEADER. This code is distributed in the hope to get us good grades, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Runs an instance of AirTrafficControlAppForConsole that has: the title "AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL app for console" ; EHL as the developer; a menu with the title Options Menu and the following representation in a String: //TODO
        OPTION MENU Add a list of flights from txt file. Update the database's flights' coordinates. Monitor Air Traffic. Report altitude transgressions. Consult a flight's details. Remove zero-passenger-flights. Remove a flight manually. Configurations. Help! Exit app. an initially empty flights' database; a reports generator; a console output formatter that draws a line filled with a sequence of 50 repetitions of the symbol ' -' as a section delimiter and prints 3 blank lines of space between sections a console input handler.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunEHLsATCAppForConsole

        public RunEHLsATCAppForConsole()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws InvalidArgumentException
        Runs an instance of AirTrafficControlAppForConsole that has:
        • the title "AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL app for console" ;
        • EHL as the developer;
        • a menu with the title Options Menu and the following representation in a String: //TODO
            OPTION MENU
          1. Add a list of flights from txt file.
          2. Update the database's flights' coordinates.
          3. Monitor Air Traffic.
          4. Report altitude transgressions.
          5. Consult a flight's details.
          6. Remove zero-passenger-flights.
          7. Remove a flight manually.
          8. Configurations.
          9. Help!
          10. Exit app.
        • an initially empty flights' database;
        • a reports generator;
        • a console output formatter that draws a line filled with a sequence of 50 repetitions of the symbol ' -' as a section delimiter and prints 3 blank lines of space between sections
        • a console input handler.

        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException
